data.title: Death Of Murray Pioneer
data.meta_description: Mr. Arthur Wilkinson, who died recently after a long illness, was one of Paringn's earliest pioneers. He was ...
data.text:
and came to the river with his

father in 1882. During his life

he took a very active part in

civic affairs.

He started experiments for

the extermination of rabbits by

the use of wood gas and con-

stant ploughing in of the bur

rows. He also continued with

a new strain of wheat, known

as the Wilkinson Early Prolific,

which had been introduced by

his father Mr. James Wilkin-

son.

He married Miss Annie Caro-

line Smith, of Warrakoo, in

1906 and settled at Murtho

Park, where he lived until his

retirement in 1946. He is sur-

vived by his widow, two sons and

seven daughters. His elder

son William is chairman of the

Paringa Council, making the

third generation to hold that

position.
